PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As more TPD was introduced into the polymer backbone , the domain spacing of P1 , P3 , P4 , P5 , and P7 gradually increased from 19.2 , 20.1 , 21.9 , 22.7 to 24.1 Å , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 19.2 Å (P1) |
| 20.1 Å (P3) |
| 21.9 Å (P4) |
| 22.7 Å (P5) |
| 24.1 Å (P1, P3, P4, P5, P7) |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions that the domain spacing of P1, P3, P4, P5, and P7 gradually increased. The initial domain spacings for P1, P3, P4, and P5 are given as 19.2 Å, 20.1 Å, 21.9 Å, and 22.7 Å, respectively. The final domain spacing for all of them is given as 24.1 Å. Therefore, P1, P3, P4, P5, and P7 are all Property Values, with the initial values being specific to each lettered polymer and the final value being the same for all of them.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 19.2 Å (P1 domain spacing) |
| 20.1 Å (P3 domain spacing) |
| 21.9 Å (P4 domain spacing) |
| 22.7 Å (P5 domain spacing) |
| 24.1 Å (final domain spacing for all) |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions that the domain spacing of P1, P3, P4, P5, and P7 gradually increased. The domain spacing is a material property, and the values given in the paragraph refer to the specific values for each lettered polymer and the final value for all of them. Therefore, all the mentioned values are Property Values. However, since the paragraph does not provide any context about what P1, P3, P4, P5, and P7 represent, it is important to include the label "P1 domain spacing", "P3 domain spacing", etc., to ensure the precision of the information.
